Articles.Content: my bet is the last one will be a picture that says something like, "Kerbal Space Program 1.0, Out Tomorrow"
No, he hasn't posted one up yet, and they're definetly cleverer than that.
New riddle for today.
Day 200 is July 19th, and that's about all I can figure out

So, let's see. First thing that caught my eye: MET for Mares is the same as absolute time: 200d 06h 06m 00s. Does this mean something?

Edit: If I'm not mistaken, a Kerbin day is 6 hours, so it must be real life days, right?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T15:51:49Z" title="04/18/2015 03:51  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by soulsource**
[Muscle Atrophy Research and Exercise System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muscle_Atrophy_Research_and_Exercise_System)? Can't be. There's not even life support in this game.

High res image:

![38ylVRH.png](http://i.imgur.com/38ylVRH.png)

my guess, the envision time 53 is 5+3=8 

i was hoping that for day 8 we would have a free return trajectory

my guess, the envision time 53 is 5+3=8

i was hoping that for day 8 we would have a free return trajectory

> 
> So, let's see. First thing that caught my eye: MET for Mares is the same as absolute time: 200d 06h 06m 00s. Does this mean something?
> Edit: If I'm not mistaken, a Kerbin day is 6 hours, so it must be real life days, right?

I'm hoping it means they slowed down Kerbin's rotation so it won't spin like a damn top. It would help increase launch delta-V requirements after reducing atmospheric drag.
That's a tough one.

Facts:

Because mission time = total time, it's a sandbox save, first launch.

Eve is the 2nd planet.

The're using Earth time, not Kerbin time.

Day 200 seems very suspect, as does exactly 6h and 6m. Though I don't know what for ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

A Mare is a sea on the Moon. It also means 'Sea' in Latin. However, in Latin, the plural of "Mare" is "Maria", not "Mares"

Envision has no specific space-related meaning I know of.

EDIT: Corrected my Latin.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-18T16:22:08Z" title="04/18/2015 04:22  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 18, 2015</time> by 5thHorseman**

Two thoughts. 

1. Mares is Spanish for seas (I believe)

2. First picture, if the boosters/tanks represent points on a clock face then #8 is missing. Could that possibly mean 8 and not 11?

> 
> Envision has no specific space-related meaning I know of.

EnVision is an orbiter satellite concept for Venus by the ESA. This fits in with the fact that it is here on Eve.

> 
> EnVision is an orbiter satellite concept for Venus by the ESA. This fits in with the fact that it is here on Eve.

The Mariner spacecraft??? Venus!

> 
> EnVision is an orbiter satellite concept for Venus by the ESA. This fits in with the fact that it is here on Eve.

If there's a connection, it's kind of strange that it is landed in the pic if it's supposed to be an orbiter.

> 
> 2. First picture, if the boosters/tanks represent points on a clock face then #8 is missing. Could that possibly mean 8 and not 11?

I had not considered a clock face. Very good idea. However, that would mean we would have to find 7 in the second image. Furthermore in Squadcast last night, Max was hinting 10 a lot.
WAIT its so simple!!! Eve, as it 1.0 EVE!! tomorrow!!!!!!!!!
Isn't short days because of the small size?

> WAIT its so simple!!! Eve, as it 1.0 EVE!! tomorrow!!!!!!!!!

Nah, it wouldn't be 11, 10, tomorrow... would it?

Hmm...

>

regex hates that, too.

[Venera 9](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venera_9)?

Just flinging metaphorical darts at the metaphorical dartboard and seeing what sticks.

An attempt at googling (which thinks mares is meant to be mars) brings up stuff about horses, the goddess venus, and some other wierd stuff.

> Just flinging metaphorical darts at the metaphorical dartboard and seeing what sticks.

You may be onto something, it's manufacturer designation was 4V-1 No. **660**... 6 hours 6 minutes 0 seconds?

So Eve, analogue to Venus. EnVision, Venus mission. Another Venus mission, Venera 9, which was numbered 660.

so.... 9 days?
